original: @132a ` // rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bzhugs /
analyzed: @132a ` // rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga bzhugs /
translated: The Ritual of the Means of Achievement of Vairocana

original: # // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: # // 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi cho gas dam tshig mnos pa'i sngags pas de las 'byung ba'i sngags rjes su dran par bya ba'i cho ga'i rim pa mdor bshad pa'i phyir 'di brtsams te de'i rim pa ni 'di'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi cho gas dam tshig mnos pa'i sngags pas de las 'byung ba'i sngags rjes su dran par bya ba'i cho ga'i rim pa mdor bshad pa'i phyir 'di brtsams te de'i rim pa ni 'di'o //
translated: For the sake of explaining in brief the sequence of the ritual of recollecting the mantra that arises from that [Vairocana] by a mantrin who has taken the vow through the ritual of Vairocana, this [treatise] is composed. The sequence of that [ritual] is as follows.

original: des dang por dam tshig ji ltar mnos pa bsrung ba la 'bad par bya ste de la dam tshig ni 'di'o //
analyzed: des dang por dam tshig ji ltar mnos pa bsrung ba la 'bad par bya ste de la dam tshig ni 'di'o //
translated: First, one should strive to guard the vow just as it was taken. The vow is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de dag gi phyag rgya dang sngags rnams dang theg pa chen po mchog gi chos dang de ston pa'i bla ma rnams la smad @132b par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang de dag gi phyag rgya dang sngags rnams dang theg pa chen po mchog gi chos dang de ston pa'i bla ma rnams la smad @132b par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disparage the buddhas and bodhisattvas, their seals and mantras, the supreme Dharma of the Great Vehicle, and the gurus who teach that [Dharma].

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'di rnams nams kyang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'di rnams nams kyang mi gtong ngo //
translated: One should never abandon these, the buddhas and so forth.

original: de dag las rtag par sems rab tu dang bas yon tan du bzung ba dang / gus pa dang mchod pa dang mnyes par bya ba la ni ci nus su yang 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las rtag par sems rab tu dang bas yon tan du bzung ba dang / gus pa dang mchod pa dang mnyes par bya ba la ni ci nus su yang 'bad par bya'o //
translated: With regard to them, one should always strive to the best of one’s ability to take them as having good qualities, to respect them, to make offerings to them, and to please them.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang de dag gi chos dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma gzhan rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i chos spyad pa bar ma dang gsar bu gzhan rnams la yang smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang de dag gi chos dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma gzhan rnams dang bde bar gshegs pa'i bslab pa'i chos spyad pa bar ma dang gsar bu gzhan rnams la yang smad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disparage any of the noble disciples and solitary sages, nor their Dharma, nor any of their teachers, preceptors, or other gurus, nor any of the precepts of the Sugata, whether intermediate or newly established.

original: de dag la yang dus ji lta ba dang / ji ltar rigs par rim gror yang bya'o //🔽lha dang bla ma la byis pa'i chos nyid dang khong khro ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang dus ji lta ba dang / ji ltar rigs par rim gror yang bya'o // lha dang bla ma la byis pa'i chos nyid dang khong khro ba mi bya'o //
translated: One should also serve them in a timely way, in whatever way is appropriate.🔽One should not be childish in one’s behavior toward gods and gurus, nor should one be hostile toward them.

original: 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa la yang smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa la yang smad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not disparage worldly gods and so forth.

original: byang chub kyi sems rin po che phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa srog bzhin du rtag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rin po che phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa srog bzhin du rtag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should always protect the precious mind of enlightenment, which is the root of all that is excellent, as one would one’s life.

original: sems can thams cad la yang byams pa dang snying rje bskyed nas de dag gi gnod pa bzlog pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang byams pa dang snying rje bskyed nas de dag gi gnod pa bzlog pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should also generate love and compassion for all sentient beings, and strive to ward off their harms.

original: de dag gis gnod pa byas pa la yang bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gnod pa byas pa la yang bzod par bya'o //
translated: One should also be patient with the harms that they do.

original: zad zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas ji ltar rigs par sems can rnams la rtag par ci nus su phan gdags par bya ste de bas na 'jug pa ni rgyang ring du spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zad zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas ji ltar rigs par sems can rnams la rtag par ci nus su phan gdags par bya ste de bas na 'jug pa ni rgyang ring du spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should always benefit sentient beings as much as one can, by means of the gifts of material things, of freedom from fear, and of the Dharma, as is appropriate. Therefore, one should abandon the pursuit of gain from afar.

original: dam tshig med pa la phyag rgya dang sngags mi bstan /
analyzed: dam tshig med pa la phyag rgya dang sngags mi bstan /
translated: One should not teach the seals and the mantras to those who do not have the commitments.

original: dam tshig can la yang lung med par mi bstan to //
analyzed: dam tshig can la yang lung med par mi bstan to //
translated: One should not teach them even to those who have the commitments, if they do not have the oral instructions.

original: ma rung bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba chang mi btung bar nan tan cher bya'o //
analyzed: ma rung bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba chang mi btung bar nan tan cher bya'o //
translated: One should make a great effort not to drink alcohol, which is the root of all misfortune.

original: mdor na gang bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa de ni mi bya'i bdag dang gzhan la phan pa 'ba' zhig tu 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na gang bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa de ni mi bya'i bdag dang gzhan la phan pa 'ba' zhig tu 'bad par bya'o //
translated: In brief, whatever is harmful to oneself and others, that should not be done. One should strive only to benefit oneself and others.

original: khri la nyal bar mi bya ste de ni dam tshig go //
analyzed: khri la nyal bar mi bya ste de ni dam tshig go //
translated: One should not sleep on a high bed. That is the rule.

original: de nas bar chad med cing ring po mi thogs par tshe 'di nyid la sgrib pa zad par bya ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bar chad med cing ring po mi thogs par tshe 'di nyid la sgrib pa zad par bya ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, without obstacles and not long, in this very life, in order to exhaust the obscurations and to accomplish the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: bla ma las sngags gang yang rung ba cig ji lta ba bzhin du mnos te /
analyzed: bla ma las sngags gang yang rung ba cig ji lta ba bzhin du mnos te /
translated: one should properly receive from a guru any suitable mantra.

original: sngags ji ltar mnos pa bslabs pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sams dpa' mnyes par bya ba'i phyir sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gong du smos pa spyod cing /
analyzed: sngags ji ltar mnos pa bslabs pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sams dpa' mnyes par bya ba'i phyir sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gong du smos pa spyod cing /
translated: Having trained in the mantra as received, in order to please the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one should practice the bodhisattva conduct through the door of mantra as mentioned above.

original: gnas dben pa 'du 'dzi med pa 'tshe ba med pa 'phrod pa'i ri phug gam sul lam nags la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @133a * //
analyzed: gnas dben pa 'du 'dzi med pa 'tshe ba med pa 'phrod pa'i ri phug gam sul lam nags la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @133a * //
translated: The place should be secluded, free from distractions, free from danger, a special place such as a mountain cave, a valley, or a forest, where the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, the noble Pratyekabuddhas and Arhats have dwelt.

original: dang 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams bzhugs bzhugs pa'am gtsug lag khang dang khang pa la sogs pa ji skad smos pa dang ldan par tshad med ba bzhi bsgoms pa'i sems kyis 'du 'dzi med par chos kyi dga' ba'i longs spyod la dad pa bskyed
analyzed: dang 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams bzhugs bzhugs pa'am gtsug lag khang dang khang pa la sogs pa ji skad smos pa dang ldan par tshad med ba bzhi bsgoms pa'i sems kyis 'du 'dzi med par chos kyi dga' ba'i longs spyod la dad pa bskyed
translated: Or it may be a temple or a hut, as described above. With a mind that has cultivated the four boundless states, one should generate faith in the enjoyment of the joy of Dharma, free from distraction.

original: de blo dang spro ba dang sems dpa' ba phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan par byas la gnod pa thams cad la ji mi snyam zhing dge bar 'tsho ba dang ldan pas dga' bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de blo dang spro ba dang sems dpa' ba phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan par byas la gnod pa thams cad la ji mi snyam zhing dge bar 'tsho ba dang ldan pas dga' bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: With a perfect, excellent mind, enthusiasm, and courage, one should abide in joy, indifferent to all harm, and endowed with a virtuous livelihood.

original: der gnas nas blo brtan pas nang par langs nas dgra'i 'khor ma lus par spangs la snying rje'i shugs kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa bsgral ba rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pas khrus byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung nges pa med de /
analyzed: der gnas nas blo brtan pas nang par langs nas dgra'i 'khor ma lus par spangs la snying rje'i shugs kyis 'gro ba ma lus pa bsgral ba rgyun mi 'chad par yid la byed pas khrus byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung nges pa med de /
translated: Having remained there, with a firm mind, one should rise in the morning, and having abandoned all the retinue of enemies, one should perform ablutions, or not, without certainty, with a compassionate impulse, liberating all beings without exception, with a mind that is uninterrupted.

original: dge bar spyad pa mtshan nyid ji skad bsgrags pa'i nang gi khrus byed pas sa gzhi gtsang mar dkyil 'khor me tog gis gtor bar sku gzugs sam mchod rten nam dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gang yang rung ba cig mdun du bzhag gam /
analyzed: dge bar spyad pa mtshan nyid ji skad bsgrags pa'i nang gi khrus byed pas sa gzhi gtsang mar dkyil 'khor me tog gis gtor bar sku gzugs sam mchod rten nam dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam gang yang rung ba cig mdun du bzhag gam /
translated: Having performed the ablutions that are virtuous, as described by the characteristics, one should scatter flowers on the pure ground, in the maṇḍala, and place in front of oneself an image, a stūpa, or a volume of the sublime Dharma.

original: sku gzugs la sogs pa med kyang rung ste shar phyogs sam byang phyogs su bltas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rab tu dang ba bskyed de de dag ji ltar rigs par phyogs bcur mngon sum bzhin du dmigs la phyag bya ba la sogs
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs pa med kyang rung ste shar phyogs sam byang phyogs su bltas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rab tu dang ba bskyed de de dag ji ltar rigs par phyogs bcur mngon sum bzhin du dmigs la phyag bya ba la sogs
translated: Even if there is no image, and so on, one should look to the east or north, generate faith in the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and, as is appropriate, visualize them in the ten directions, as if directly perceived, and pay homage, and so on.

original: pa'i cho gas bdag yongs su sbyangs pa 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i cho gas bdag yongs su sbyangs pa 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: One should purify oneself with this rite of the pledge-vows.

original: de dag gi rim pa ni 'di'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa ni 'di'o //
translated: The stages of this are as follows.

original: dang por sngags pas yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te rim gro bskyed la gus par phyag 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: dang por sngags pas yan lag lnga sa la gtugs te rim gro bskyed la gus par phyag 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: First, the mantrin should touch the five limbs to the ground, generate respect, and make obeisance like this.

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dam pa'i chos su bcas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun du bcas pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dam pa'i chos su bcas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun du bcas pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to all the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas dwelling in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, to the holy Dharma, and to the Saṅgha of the great bodhisattvas.

original: de nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas btud de bsam pa thag pa nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha ngas la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas btud de bsam pa thag pa nas 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: Then, kneeling on the right knee, with palms joined, bowing down, one should utter this with a sincere mind:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba skye ba thog ma ma mchis pa nas 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i las gang bdag gis bgyid pa dang @133b bgyid du stsal ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang de dag thams cad sangs rgyas dang
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba skye ba thog ma ma mchis pa nas 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i las gang bdag gis bgyid pa dang @133b bgyid du stsal ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang de dag thams cad sangs rgyas dang
translated: I, by the name so-and-so, from beginningless time in cyclic existence, in the course of my actions, whatever non-virtuous actions I have done, caused to be done, or rejoiced in, all of those I confess individually in the presence of the buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la so sor bshags so zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la so sor bshags so zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: de nas skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
translated: Then, going for refuge:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: I, by the name so-and-so, from this time forward

original: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: until I reach the essence of enlightenment, go for refuge to the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhi ba'i chos kyi sku so so rang gis rig pa la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhi ba'i chos kyi sku so so rang gis rig pa la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: I go for refuge to the unsurpassed, peaceful Dharma body of the tathagatas, which is individually realized.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun rnams la skyabs su mchi'o zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun rnams la skyabs su mchi'o zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: I go for refuge to the noble Sangha of great bodhisattvas who are irreversible from the ten directions.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu bdag gi ngo bo dbul te /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu bdag gi ngo bo dbul te /
translated: Then, after that, offer yourself:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dus 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me. I, by the name so-and-so, from this time forward

original: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag gi ngo bo dus thams cad du yong ye 'bul gyis thugs rje chen po rnams kyis bdag ba zhes shig ces lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag gi ngo bo dus thams cad du yong ye 'bul gyis thugs rje chen po rnams kyis bdag ba zhes shig ces lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: until the heart of awakening, always offer myself to all buddhas and bodhisattvas. Please accept me with great compassion.

original: de nas sems can sdug bsngal ba thams cad la snying rje chen po mngon du bya ste byang chub kyi sems rin po che bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de nas sems can sdug bsngal ba thams cad la snying rje chen po mngon du bya ste byang chub kyi sems rin po che bskyed pa ni /
translated: Then, after that, generate the precious mind of awakening:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me.

original: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes pa /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang bral ba phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa chos bdag med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis rang gi sems thog ma nas ma skyes pa /
translated: Free from all things, devoid of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and free from the duality of apprehended and apprehender, by the sameness of the selflessness of phenomena, my mind is primordially unborn.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs kyi bar du ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yang dus 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs kyi bar du ji ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de bzhin du bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yang dus 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: Just as those bhagavān buddhas and bodhisattvas generated the mind of awakening, so also I, by name, from this time forward🔽until reaching the seat of awakening, generate the mind of awakening.

original: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: nam byang chub kyi snying po la mchis kyi bar du byang chub tu sems bskyed do zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: Say that three times.

original: de nas bsod nams gyi rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams gyi rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bdag la dgongs su gsol /
translated: Then, rejoicing in merit: All buddhas and bodhisattvas, please heed me.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi @134a * //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi @134a * //
translated: I, by the name so-and-so, rejoice in the unsurpassed merit🔽of all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of all the Bodhisattvas, of all the Solitary Sages, and of all the Disciples, as well as in the merit of all living beings.

original: rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams dang 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ngo zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bdag kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang 'phags pa rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams dang 'gro ba ma lus pa'i bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ngo zhes lan gsum du brjod do //
translated: Just as the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, know it, so do I rejoice in the merit of all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of all the Bodhisattvas, of all the Solitary Sages, of all the Disciples, and of all living beings.

original: de nas gsol ba gdab pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen pos chos kyi char dbab pa dang thabs dang tshul sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi don mdzad cing rtag tu bzhugs par gsol zhes lan gsum
analyzed: de nas gsol ba gdab pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen pos chos kyi char dbab pa dang thabs dang tshul sna tshogs kyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi don mdzad cing rtag tu bzhugs par gsol zhes lan gsum
translated: Then, one should make the request: “I request all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who abide in all the realms of sentient beings, to remain and to turn the wheel of the Dharma with great compassion, and to act for the benefit of all beings through various means and methods.”

original: du brjod do //
analyzed: du brjod do //
translated: One should say this three times.

original: de nas sems can la phan pa bstabs pa ni sems can thams cad ngan pa'i mtha' dbugs ma phyin pa so so'i skye bo'i gnas myur du spangs te bde ba mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par gyur cig / dam
analyzed: de nas sems can la phan pa bstabs pa ni sems can thams cad ngan pa'i mtha' dbugs ma phyin pa so so'i skye bo'i gnas myur du spangs te bde ba mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob par gyur cig / dam
translated: May all sentient beings quickly abandon the state of ordinary beings, who are not free from the danger of the lower realms, and attain the supramundane path that leads to the bliss of nirvana.

original: sngar bsam pa'i don de dag thams cad sems can gyi khams 'dir ji ltar rigs par myur du 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //
analyzed: sngar bsam pa'i don de dag thams cad sems can gyi khams 'dir ji ltar rigs par myur du 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //
translated: may all those intended meanings that were previously contemplated quickly arise in this realm of sentient beings, in whatever way is appropriate, for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de nas sems can gyi don gyi byin gyis rlob pa'i rig sngags nam mkha'i mjod 'byung par mdzad pa 'di lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: de nas sems can gyi don gyi byin gyis rlob pa'i rig sngags nam mkha'i mjod 'byung par mdzad pa 'di lan gsum brjod do //
translated: Then, one should recite three times this mantra that accomplishes the blessing for the benefit of sentient beings, which produces the sky treasury:

original: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga te bhyo bi shva mu khe bhya: sarba th'a kham audga te spha ra na ai mam ga ga na kham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga te bhyo bi shva mu khe bhya: sarba th'a kham audga te spha ra na ai mam ga ga na kham sv'a h'a /
translated: Namo all tathāgatas, the hosts of victors, to all the elements of enlightenment, I offer. May there be the sound of space. Svāhā.

original: 'di lan gsum bzlas pas ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams sems can gyi khams 'dir de bzhin du 'gyur bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: 'di lan gsum bzlas pas ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams sems can gyi khams 'dir de bzhin du 'gyur bar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhyen gyi /
translated: By reciting this three times, whatever one has thought about will come to pass in this realm of sentient beings, as the buddhas and bodhisattvas know.

original: gzhan shes pa chung ngu rnams kyis ni mi shes so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan shes pa chung ngu rnams kyis ni mi shes so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One has said that this is not known to others of lesser understanding.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis ying ches par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis ying ches par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those of the bodhisattva vehicle should have confidence in this.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par byas shing 'gro ba ma lus ba'i don byas pa des bdag gis lha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge dgod pa la sogs pas bdag nyid lha'i skur bsgyur la yi ge ham dkar po yang spyi bor bzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes par byas shing 'gro ba ma lus ba'i don byas pa des bdag gis lha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge dgod pa la sogs pas bdag nyid lha'i skur bsgyur la yi ge ham dkar po yang spyi bor bzhag ste /
translated: In this way, having pleased the tathāgatas and accomplished the welfare of the entire world, one should transform oneself into the body of the deity by means of the placement of the divine seal and the syllables of the mantra, and so forth. Placing the white syllable haṃ on the crown of one's head,

original: @137b mdun du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsams la der yi ge sbyar ba byas te dbugs dang dran pa rab tu bsngams nas slar sdud pa'i tshig gis non par yid la'am /
analyzed: @137b mdun du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsams la der yi ge sbyar ba byas te dbugs dang dran pa rab tu bsngams nas slar sdud pa'i tshig gis non par yid la'am /
translated: Having visualized the Blessed Buddha in front of oneself, one should recite the mantra there, having well-controlled one's breath and mindfulness.

original: bshubs te / mi drag mi ngal bar ma skyo ba'am ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //🔽slob dpon dbang bskur bas ni bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bsgyur te /
analyzed: bshubs te / mi drag mi ngal bar ma skyo ba'am ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du bzlas par bya'o // slob dpon dbang bskur bas ni bdag de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bsgyur te /
translated: One should recite without haste, without fatigue, without weariness, or for as long as one wishes, either mentally or aloud, with the words of the mantra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'am byang chub sems dpa'i sngags zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhag nas bzlas bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'am byang chub sems dpa'i sngags zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhag nas bzlas bar bya'o //
translated: One who has been initiated as a master should transform oneself into the body of the Tathagata, and recite the mantra of the Tathagata or a Bodhisattva, placing it on the moon disk.

original: ji skad du bshad pa ltar ma nus na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs pa'i sems sam ;
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa ltar ma nus na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs pa'i sems sam ;
translated: If one is unable to do as explained, one should recite with a mind focused on paying homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: / sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la rjes su yi rang bar dmigs shing bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: / sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la rjes su yi rang bar dmigs shing bzlas par bya'o //
translated: or with a mind focused on rejoicing in the perfect benefit of sentient beings.

original: de nas ngal lam gtong 'dod na bzlas pa btang ste /
analyzed: de nas ngal lam gtong 'dod na bzlas pa btang ste /
translated: Then, if one is tired or wishes to stop, one should stop the recitation,

original: yang las kyi rdo rjer bdag bsgyur la snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstod cing mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: yang las kyi rdo rjer bdag bsgyur la snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstod cing mchod pa byas la /
translated: Again, transforming oneself into the karma-vajra, one praises and makes offerings to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas as before.

original: dge ba ci byas yongs su bsngos la bdag kyang dge ba'i las 'dis sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol nus par gyur cig / bdag nam sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang skyes so cog tu byang chub kyi sems yongs
analyzed: dge ba ci byas yongs su bsngos la bdag kyang dge ba'i las 'dis sangs rgyas su gyur nas sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol nus par gyur cig / bdag nam sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang skyes so cog tu byang chub kyi sems yongs
translated: Having dedicated whatever virtue has been created, one should say, “By this virtuous action, may I become a Buddha and be able to liberate all sentient beings from the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: su rdzogs par byed pa'i bdag gi ngo bo dang / 'khor dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs par shog shig ces brjod do //
analyzed: su rdzogs par byed pa'i bdag gi ngo bo dang / 'khor dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs par shog shig ces brjod do //
translated: Until I become a Buddha, in all my lives may I be able to perfect the thought of enlightenment, and may I have a body, retinue, spiritual friends, and enjoyments that are perfect.”

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' skyong ba rnams bdag theg pa chen po las mi nyams shing khyad par thob par byin gyis rlob shig ces gsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' skyong ba rnams bdag theg pa chen po las mi nyams shing khyad par thob par byin gyis rlob shig ces gsol ba bya'o //
translated: After that, one should request the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who are the protectors to bless one so that one will not fall from the Mahayana and will attain the special qualities.

original: de nas yon chab phul te /
analyzed: de nas yon chab phul te /
translated: Then, one should offer water for the feet.

original: gdon mi za bar bdag la yang //🔽rjes su gzung par dgongs nas su //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag la yang // rjes su gzung par dgongs nas su //
translated: I will certainly be accepted

original: sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa rnams //🔽ci bde bar ni gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa rnams // ci bde bar ni gshegs su gsol //
translated: by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas sbyi bor dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya byas te gyen du dkrol nas sngar dam tshig gi phyir zhugs pa rnams gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sbyi bor dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya byas te gyen du dkrol nas sngar dam tshig gi phyir zhugs pa rnams gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having made the seal of the three sacred commitments on the crown of one’s head, and having unraveled it upward, one should request the departure of those who entered for the sake of the sacred commitment.

original: mtshams bcad ba'ang yid kyis dgrol lo //
analyzed: mtshams bcad ba'ang yid kyis dgrol lo //
translated: One should also mentally untie the boundary.

original: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas bdag chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyis bdag rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis @138a * //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas bdag chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyis bdag rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis @138a * //
translated: Then, having blessed oneself as the realm of phenomena with the seal of the realm of phenomena, one should bless oneself as Vajrasattva with the seal and the mantra of Vajrasattva.

original: brlab po // sbyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge'ang bsam mo //
analyzed: brlab po // sbyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge'ang bsam mo //
translated: One should also imagine the syllable of the realm of phenomena on the crown of one’s head.

original: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgyas go cha yang bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yid la byas nas dge ba'i las dam pa bya bar bsams shing ldang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgyas go cha yang bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yid la byas nas dge ba'i las dam pa bya bar bsams shing ldang ngo //
translated: Having also donned the armor with the vajra-armor gesture, and having brought to mind all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one should rise, thinking of performing the highest virtuous action.

original: langs nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ston pa'i mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba dag lha la sogs pa gnyer te chos sbyin pa'i sems kyis bklag go //
analyzed: langs nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ston pa'i mdo sde zab cing rgya che ba dag lha la sogs pa gnyer te chos sbyin pa'i sems kyis bklag go //
translated: Having risen, one should read the profound and extensive sūtras that teach the bodhisattva way of life, with the intention of giving the gift of Dharma to the gods and so forth.

original: de nas lus gso ba'i phyir zas bza' ba'i rim pa'ang 'di'o //
analyzed: de nas lus gso ba'i phyir zas bza' ba'i rim pa'ang 'di'o //
translated: Then, this is the procedure for eating food in order to nourish the body.

original: dang por ci 'byor pa'i zas la sngags lan gsum nam bdun du gdab po //🔽na ma ssa manta bu ddh'a n'am /
analyzed: dang por ci 'byor pa'i zas la sngags lan gsum nam bdun du gdab po // na ma ssa manta bu ddh'a n'am /
translated: First, one should incant the food three or seven times with the mantra.🔽Namo ratna-trayāya |

original: aom aa mi todbha ba sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa mi todbha ba sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ amitodbhavasvaha

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phud phul te /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phud phul te /
translated: Then, having offered the first portion to the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: de'i 'og tu sems can la yang byin la ro la ma chags par rigs pa dang ran par bza'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can la yang byin la ro la ma chags par rigs pa dang ran par bza'o //
translated: one should give it to sentient beings afterwards, and eat it in a reasonable and moderate way, without attachment to taste.

original: de nas 'phags pa mi g-yo ba la drag po gdon mi za ba'i snying pos zas kyi lhag ma'i chang bu la btab ste dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa mi g-yo ba la drag po gdon mi za ba'i snying pos zas kyi lhag ma'i chang bu la btab ste dbul lo //
translated: Then, to the noble Acala, one should offer the remainder of the food, having enchanted it with the essence of the irresistible Rudra.

original: de'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni /
translated: His mantra is:

original: na ma ssa manta badzr'a n'am /
analyzed: na ma ssa manta badzr'a n'am /
translated: namaḥ samantabuddhānāṃ

original: tra ta aa mo gha tsanda ma h'a rosha na spho ta ya h'um tra ta ya ham mam /
analyzed: tra ta aa mo gha tsanda ma h'a rosha na spho ta ya h'um tra ta ya ham mam /
translated: trata amogha candra mahāroṣana sphuṭaya hūṃ trāṭaya mama

original: gdon mi za bar drag po'i snying po'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar drag po'i snying po'o //
translated: The essence of the irresistible one.

original: de ltar byas na de mnyes nas rtag tu bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na de mnyes nas rtag tu bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it in this way, he will be pleased and will always protect.

original: de nas zas zos te ngal bso nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags la sogs pa de bzhin du bya ste dam pa'i chos kun du dga' bar gnas so //
analyzed: de nas zas zos te ngal bso nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba dang / sdig pa bshags la sogs pa de bzhin du bya ste dam pa'i chos kun du dga' bar gnas so //
translated: Then, having eaten the food and rested, one should do the homage to all the Tathāgatas, the confession of sins, and so forth, as before, and abide in the delight of the holy Dharma.

original: de'i phyi dro 'ang bzlas pa'i cho ga snga ma bzhin du byas nas srod dang tho rangs la dam pa'i chos la brtson par bya ste nam gyi gung la mal sa bcas par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag kun gyis phyag 'tshal
analyzed: de'i phyi dro 'ang bzlas pa'i cho ga snga ma bzhin du byas nas srod dang tho rangs la dam pa'i chos la brtson par bya ste nam gyi gung la mal sa bcas par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag kun gyis phyag 'tshal
translated: He should go to bed at midnight, and after prostrating with his whole body to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: nas / byang chub kyi sems rin po che rjes su dran par byas te /
analyzed: nas / byang chub kyi sems rin po che rjes su dran par byas te /
translated: he should recollect the precious mind of enlightenment.

original: khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir nyal gyi gnyid kyi bde ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //🔽snga glo g-yas pas nyal na phyis ni ci bder ro //
analyzed: khams snyoms par bya ba'i phyir nyal gyi gnyid kyi bde ba'i phyir ni ma yin no // snga glo g-yas pas nyal na phyis ni ci bder ro //
translated: He should go to sleep in order to refresh his faculties, not in order to enjoy the pleasure of sleep.🔽He should lie down on his right side, his head covered, and his feet placed one on top of the other.

original: de nas phyi de nyin yang cho ga de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi de nyin yang cho ga de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The next day, he should perform the rite in the same way.

original: de ltar sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i sbyad pa spyod pas rgyun mi 'chad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i sbyad pa spyod pas rgyun mi 'chad par bya'o //
translated: In this way, he should practice the bodhisattva deeds through the door of mantra without interruption.

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin mi nus na yang ci nus pas sngags kyi lha mnyes par bya'i mi rung snyam pa'i dogs pa ni mi bskyed do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin mi nus na yang ci nus pas sngags kyi lha mnyes par bya'i mi rung snyam pa'i dogs pa ni mi bskyed do //
translated: Even if he is unable to do as explained, he should not give rise to the worry that thinks, “It is not suitable to please the deity of the mantra.”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @138b rnams rjer bzung ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam gdab pa 'di gnyis ni yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' @138b rnams rjer bzung ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam gdab pa 'di gnyis ni yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: One should not abandon these two: holding the buddhas and bodhisattvas as supreme, and making aspirational prayers for unsurpassed, perfect, full awakening.

original: 'di gnyis yongs su ma btang na cho ga gzhan rnams ma nus kyang bzlas pa rtag par brtson 'grus su byas na das kyang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub dngos par thob po //
analyzed: 'di gnyis yongs su ma btang na cho ga gzhan rnams ma nus kyang bzlas pa rtag par brtson 'grus su byas na das kyang rjes su mthun pa'i dngos grub dngos par thob po //
translated: If one does not abandon these two, even if one is unable to perform the other rites, if one always strives in the recitation, one will obtain the corresponding accomplishments.

original: 'di la nang gi gtsang sbra gtso bo ste de bas na phyi rol gyi gtsang sbra la chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la nang gi gtsang sbra gtso bo ste de bas na phyi rol gyi gtsang sbra la chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, inner purity is primary, so one should not be attached to external purity.

original: bza' ba 'dres pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i dogs pa yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba 'dres pa la sogs pa nyes pa'i dogs pa yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be concerned about the faults of mixed food and so on.

original: lus gso ba'i phyir ni phyi rol gyi khrus la sogs pa yang bya ste /
analyzed: lus gso ba'i phyir ni phyi rol gyi khrus la sogs pa yang bya ste /
translated: For the sake of nourishing the body, one should also perform external bathing and so on.

original: de'ang 'bab chu la sogs par khrus byed 'dod na thog mar 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i sngags kyis sa gtsang ma blangs te lan gsum bsngags la sngags des bdag bsrungs la chu'i gdug pa 'ang bskrad de /
analyzed: de'ang 'bab chu la sogs par khrus byed 'dod na thog mar 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i sngags kyis sa gtsang ma blangs te lan gsum bsngags la sngags des bdag bsrungs la chu'i gdug pa 'ang bskrad de /
translated: If one wishes to bathe in a waterfall, etc., first one should take clean earth with the mantra of Ārya Acalā, incant it three times, and protect oneself with that mantra. One should also drive away the dangers of the water.

original: mtshams bcad la sngags de chu la'ang bsngags te ;
analyzed: mtshams bcad la sngags de chu la'ang bsngags te ;
translated: Having established the boundaries, one should incant the water with that mantra.

original: / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la'ang mang du phul nas yid la dran par byed cing /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la'ang mang du phul nas yid la dran par byed cing /
translated: Having offered it to the buddhas and bodhisattvas many times, one should remember it.

original: sa des ya rabs kyi tshul bzhin khrus bya'o //
analyzed: sa des ya rabs kyi tshul bzhin khrus bya'o //
translated: One should bathe with that earth in the manner of the noble ones.

original: de nas dam tshig la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gsum po byas la chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge 'ang sbyi bor bsam /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gsum po byas la chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge 'ang sbyi bor bsam /
translated: Then, having made the three mudrās such as the samaya mudrā, one should visualize the syllable of the dharmadhātu on the crown.

original: rdo rje go chas kyang bdag go bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag phul te sems can la phan par bsngags pa byas nas phyag 'tshal te ldang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje go chas kyang bdag go bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag phul te sems can la phan par bsngags pa byas nas phyag 'tshal te ldang ngo //
translated: Having also donned the vajra armor, one should pay homage to the buddhas and bodhisattvas, praise them for benefiting sentient beings, and rise up.

original: mtshams bcad pa'ang yid kyis dkrol la gnas su mi g-yeng bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa'ang yid kyis dkrol la gnas su mi g-yeng bar 'gro'o //
translated: Having mentally untied the boundary, one should go to the place without distraction.

original: yang na khrus kyi gnas de nyid du snga ma bzhin du bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khrus kyi gnas de nyid du snga ma bzhin du bzlas pa'o //
translated: Or, in that very place of bathing, one should recite as before.

original: nyin re zhing rjes su dran pa de ltar byas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshogs bsags pa dang / go 'phang dam pa ring por mi thogs par 'thob cing tshe 'di nyid la 'tshe ba thams cad med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dngos grub thams cad nus par myur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin re zhing rjes su dran pa de ltar byas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshogs bsags pa dang / go 'phang dam pa ring por mi thogs par 'thob cing tshe 'di nyid la 'tshe ba thams cad med pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dngos grub thams cad nus par myur du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs this recollection in this way every day, one will quickly attain the accumulation of the requisites for omniscience and the holy state, and in this very life all harm will be absent and all accomplishments, both with and without signs, will quickly be accomplished.

original: mtshan ma med pa zab ces te //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zab ces te //
translated: The signless is said to be profound,

original: dman pa rnams kyis mi lcogs pas //
analyzed: dman pa rnams kyis mi lcogs pas //
translated: but it is not possible for the inferior ones.

original: de phyir mtshan ma cho ga can //
analyzed: de phyir mtshan ma cho ga can //
translated: Therefore, the one with the rite of signs

original: skyon med pa ni 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni 'dir bshad do //
translated: is explained here as faultless.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga / slob dpon rgyal ba'i 'od kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga / slob dpon rgyal ba'i 'od kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ritual of the method of accomplishing Vairocana, composed by Ācārya Jayāpīḍa, is complete.
